metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18509 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw during verification of certain S/MIME signatures causes emails to be shown in Thunderbird as having a valid digital signature, even if the shown message contents aren't covered by the signature. The flaw allows an attacker to reuse a valid S/MIME signature to craft an email message with arbitrary content. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.5.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
